pixi.core.renderers.webgl.filters.AbstractFilter

type
class
subclasses
pixi.filters.ascii.AsciiFilter, pixi.filters.blur.BlurFilter, pixi.filters.blur.BlurXFilter, pixi.filters.blur.BlurYFilter, pixi.filters.blur.SmartBlurFilter, pixi.filters.color.ColorMatrixFilter, pixi.filters.color.ColorStepFilter, pixi.filters.gray.GrayFilter, pixi.filters.pixelate.PixelateFilter, pixi.filters.twist.TwistFilter
metadata
:native
"PIXI.AbstractFilter"

Constructor

new(vertexSrc : String, fragmentSrc : String, uniforms : Dynamic)
parameters
vertexSrc {String|String[]} The vertex shader source as an array of strings.
fragmentSrc {String|String[]} The fragment shader source as an array of strings.
uniforms {object} An object containing the uniforms for this filter.
This is the base class for creating a PIXI filter. Currently only WebGL supports filters. If you want to make a custom filter this should be your base class.

Instance Variables

padding : Float

The extra padding that the filter might need

Instance Methods

applyFilter(renderer : pixi.core.renderers.webgl.WebGLRenderer, input : Dynamic, output : Dynamic, clear : Bool) : Void

getShader(renderer : pixi.core.renderers.webgl.WebGLRenderer) : Dynamic

syncUniform(uniform : Dynamic) : Void

Syncs a uniform between the class object and the shaders.
